faqs.question: Why is my laptop overheating?
faqs.answer: Your laptop may be overheating due to dust buildup or poor ventilation. Clean the vents and avoid soft surfaces like beds.

faqs.question: My laptop is connected to WiFi but I can't access internet.
faqs.answer: Try restarting your router. If that doesn’t work, reset DNS or check proxy settings.

faqs.question: I entered the correct password but can’t log in.
faqs.answer: Check for Caps Lock or keyboard layout issues. Try resetting your password if possible.

faqs.question: My screen is black after turning on the laptop.
faqs.answer: This could be a display driver issue. Try connecting to an external monitor or boot into Safe Mode.

faqs.question: The touchpad is not working on my laptop.
faqs.answer: Try pressing Fn + Touchpad icon key. Also check settings to ensure the touchpad is enabled.

faqs.question: My laptop shuts down suddenly even with battery left.
faqs.answer: Check for overheating or battery calibration issues. It may also be due to faulty RAM or power settings.

faqs.question: Audio is not working after Windows update.
faqs.answer: Your audio driver might need to be updated or rolled back. Check Device Manager for driver status.

faqs.question: The keyboard types wrong characters.
faqs.answer: Check the input language or keyboard layout. Also ensure Num Lock and Fn keys aren’t changing input.

faqs.question: USB device not recognized.
faqs.answer: Try a different port. If that fails, uninstall the USB controllers from Device Manager and restart.

faqs.question: Battery drains quickly.
faqs.answer: Lower brightness, close unused apps, and disable background processes. Run a battery health check.

faqs.question: Laptop is too slow after startup.
faqs.answer: Disable startup programs, uninstall unused apps, and check for malware with a full system scan.

faqs.question: Laptop fan is always loud.
faqs.answer: This may be due to overheating or dust. Clean the fan and check for CPU-intensive tasks running.

faqs.question: I forgot my laptop password.
faqs.answer: You can reset your password using a password reset disk or recovery options available during boot.

faqs.question: My Bluetooth is not connecting.
faqs.answer: Turn Bluetooth off and back on, remove the paired device, and re-pair it. Also try updating Bluetooth drivers.

faqs.question: Laptop gets stuck on manufacturer logo.
faqs.answer: Try booting into safe mode or running startup repair from recovery options.

faqs.question: Webcam not detected.
faqs.answer: Check if it’s disabled in Device Manager. Update the driver or enable it from BIOS if necessary.

faqs.question: Laptop won’t turn on at all.
faqs.answer: Try holding the power button for 30 seconds. Plug in charger and look for signs of power (LED light, fan).

faqs.question: How to stop automatic Windows updates?
faqs.answer: You can pause updates in Windows settings or disable the update service through Services app.

faqs.question: Laptop gets stuck during Windows update.
faqs.answer: Be patient for at least 2 hours. If it’s stuck beyond that, force shut down and perform system restore.

faqs.question: Screen flickers randomly.
faqs.answer: Update display drivers or disable hardware acceleration in system settings.

faqs.question: My files are missing after Windows update.
faqs.answer: Check if they moved to a different user profile or recovery folder. Try using File History or a recovery tool.

faqs.question: The clock is always incorrect on my laptop.
faqs.answer: Sync with internet time server or replace the CMOS battery if it resets every time the laptop reboots.
